Reviews.Content: Loved this hptel We stayed at the Hotel Royal in 2007 and I was just reading the reviews out of curiosity and am amazed that the hotel has received such poor reviews. We went out of season so the cost was reasonable - 拢60 per night for a double including breakfast. We thought the hotel was lovely andthe staff very friendly. The town centre was walking distance. I used to live in Florence and now work in tourism and for 拢60 per night I thought this was excellent value for money. Spotlessly clean, ok so the bar wasn't brilliant, but we had a drink, breakfast wasn't brilliant but we ate and we didn't have a car so didn't need to pay for parking. I would definitely stay there again - the hotel is beautiful and old and Florentine and typical.
Reviews.Author: diggydoo

Reviews.Content: Do not stay in Hotel Royal, Florence I booked a single room for 5 days at the Hotel Royal in Florence. The price of the single room was 200$. I was staying to Florence for a conference. I did not have much time available.Disappointment no1: I arrived at the hotel late in the evening. When I saw the room, I was so surprised! The room was literally 2x2 square meters. It was like a wardrobe. It was extremely small and the window was like a small hole in the wall. I could not believe my eyes! So, I went to the reception and asked them if they had a double room available.Disappointment no2: The reception was very rude. He gave me the key of the room and he commanded me: 鈥楥heck the room and bring the key back to me immediately!鈥?br/>Disappointment no3: This double room was bigger and its price was 270$. I decided to stay. I thought of working on my computer for a while before going to sleep. At my surprise, I noticed that there was no socket to charge my computer!Disappointment no4: I thought then, that I could read instead. I took my book but.... there was no bed-sit lamp next to the bed.Disappointment no5: I said to myself that everything was fine. I needed to call my partner to inform that I had arrived safely in Florence and to tell him how horrible Hotel Royal was. I tried to call but there was no signal. I called the reception to ask what is digit for calling numbers abroad and he did not know. I tried every possible combination and I did not finally manage, leaving my partner worrying.Disappointment no6: I decided to go to sleep. I could not sleep because the light of the street was getting into the room.Disappointment no7: Also, there was a lot of noise from the street, even though I requested a quite room.Disappointment no8: After several hours, I managed to get some sleep. In the morning, I went downstairs to get my breakfast. It was horrible. They did not even have fresh coffee! It was all a joke.Disappointment no9: I decided to stay as I did not have the courage and time to start looking for another hotel. My only concern was my mother who was going to stay with me 2 days in that terrible place. I informed the reception about her arrival.My mother came and she stayed 1 night in my room. When I was about to leave the hotel the next morning, the reception tells me that the charges are higher now that my mother came and she randomly quoted the room for 310$.It was then that I flipped! They wanted more money but they did not even bother to bring a second towel for my mother! (They only provide 1 towel).I expressed my disagreement to the reception who instead of listening to what I had to say, she was replying back to me. After staying 3 nights, I packed my suitcase and I went to another hotel!So, in summary, do not stay in Hotel Royal in Florence!1. The staff is very rude2. The rooms do not have sockets to charge your phone/computer3. The rooms do not have a set of towels4. The rooms do not have bed-sit lamps5. The rooms are very noisy especially those looking at the parking of the hotel.6. The rooms do not always have telephone that works7. The breakfast is ridiculous8. The price is expensive for what you get.
Reviews.Author: dchaita1979

Reviews.Content: very unfriendly! We stayed in Florence for 2 nights and decided to book the Hotel Royal because of the private parking and the good location to the historical city. The hotel looks like a little palace with a big garden, swimmingpool an private parking. The rooms are very clean, beautiful and quiet. Everything seems to be perfect except the staff and the breakfast! The whole staff was very unfriendly! The breakfast was an ordinary breakfast and not a buffet. You could not take seat in summer at the beautiful terrace in the inside garden to eat your breakfast. But if you would prefer to sit outside in the sun you had to pay Euro 5!!!! Also you had to pay Euro 15 to use the swimmingpool! The fee for the parkingspace was about Euro 20 per day and - you had to pay it on arrival not together with the hotel bill. If you decide to have a drink before you go to bed - don't do that! They have no varity of drinks and the staff is not to be keen on serving the guests.Summary: the hotel ist very nice and quiet, the rooms are clean and beautiful, the location is perfect, the price is ok - but not the staff and the breakfast! Also the rules of the hotel are curious!
Reviews.Author: Zeitreisende

Reviews.Content: Horrible place to stay in I'm Italian, and I decided to spend one night in Florence with some friends from Rome.I contacted the hotel for a last minute planned visit in Florence for a weekend. I had the hotel name from a friend of mine who stayed there long time ago. I was surprised not to receive any confirmation of my booking sent by fax to them. Although if I arrived to the hotel at 13:00, the reception (not friendly at all) told me that it wasn't possible to check in until 14:00! The facility is quite old and not well maintained, but the most horrible experience of the whole staying was the breakfast on the following morning. People serving the breakfast were able just to complain and shout the customers. Cappuccino was horrible (made of water!) so as the rest that they call buffet on their website, that is a very short choice of few items (the bread looked very old). For sure the service we had was not the one we should have had for the cost of the room (140鈧?for a Double room is a real theft).
Reviews.Author: Cinzia_88

Reviews.Content: Very old and far! We are two women friends visiting Florence then Venice and taking a Cruise in Greece with the Costa Mediterranea. Stayed at this Hotel Sept 1st, 2007 till the next day.First I must say that the parking lot is not very convenient (little rocks) for rolling your suitcase. A taxi must drive you up in front, ours left us in the middle of the road? Plus you should not give any tip to the taxi driver since the price was included. We had to take a cab lots of time because it is FAR from the main tourist attraction (Ponte Vechio ect). People are not to smilly at the front desk. The breakfast stop being served at 9:30 so we mist it then we ask where we should go close arround...well they didn't know???The room is small and the beds are awful. Both our twin beds were tipping on one side, not very comfortable to sleep on it because you think you are going to fall off the bed during your sleep.The inside is very very dark and quite old with antiques every where you look.But Florence is just so beautiful to visit, but 2 days would be enough. Then we took the train for Venice because the train station is not a walking distance from this Hotel believe me. So we took a Taxi 14 euros worth every penny. If you buy a train ticket in advance and want to leave earlier you could change it (but you pay 4 euros per ticket , in the train) not at the ticket counter of the station.For conclusion look somewhere else I'm sure you will find a better place AND WORTH the difference.
Reviews.Author: Liette

Reviews.Content: Watch out Location okand easy to find. Not to far to walk to main sites and attractions. Market close by. No internet available in hotel - disappointing.Parking available but carries an extra charge of 20 euros per day. This was not mentioned on website and has to be paid in cash on arrival.Swimming pool was an attractive facility but carries an admission charge of 12 euros per person per day. The room information stated 20 euros per day. The idea of paying for a pool was new to me.Room was comfortable but slightly unpleasant smell in the en-suite bathroom. Toiletries provided were good. Breakfast was fine but on the two days wew ere threre the coffeee was undrinkable. Shame.
Reviews.Author: Neptune24

Reviews.Content: Served its purpose but be aware Hotel was as expected having read reviews on Tripadvisor before booking - so was aware of 'poor coffee' etc but we had specifically booked this hotel for the pool facility it offers. Idea was to arrive after travelling from Pisa to laze around the pool before tackling the sights of Florence. Hotel fails to indicate a hefty charge of 12 euros per person, per visit to pool for swimming or sunbathing. Having already paid City prices for our booking we did not feel inclined to pay more for a facility which is usually included - unless it is part of a hotels fitness centre. This meant that the pool was only used by two children in the two days we were there. What a waste as it would greatly improve the chance of guests staying around the hotel and taking advantage of bar facilities etc. later in the evening. Maybe the hotel could take note and charge (if they must) a nominal charge per stay - or at least indicate the extra charge in their information. Having said that, the hotel delivered what we required and we were satisfied with the booking as a whole.
Reviews.Author: EnglandGuest

Reviews.Content: Too expensive The hotel location is good. Just 10 minutes walk from the railway station and 5 minutes walk to Piazza Santa Croce.The hotel has an excellent impact at the reception, but the room are absolutely normal.The cleaning of the hotel is generally good, but in my room I've found many mosquito that in the night has waked me up more than one time. There are also some mosquito killed on the wall...by previous guests. I think that in July/Agust the situation could be more difficult.The breakfast is absolutely not adeguated to the hotel class and the price. No fresh fruit is available for breakfast.In the past month I stayed in a 2 star hotel, and I've paid 1/2 than I've paid here, and I was satisfied at the same way, then if I've to stay in Florence again, I will choose the 2 start hotel...
Reviews.Author: Giorgiob75

Reviews.Content: Beware the internet booking We booked a couple of rooms over the internet and the rate we got was quite good. However, the reason for this became readily apparent upon check-in. One room was particularly small with only one very little window up near the roof. The other room was larger but actually located away from the main building out in the garden. It is probably great in summer, but in winter the room was cold, water pressure poor and the heater noisy but ineffective. A positive is the hotel staff who were all honest, friendly and helpful.
Reviews.Author: GJLondon

Reviews.Content: Buonisimo in september 2005, our school went on a study tour of Italy. Our first stop was florence, and i absolutely loved every minute of it. When we first arrived at Royal most of the room hadnt been completely made up yet, so we had 2 dump our bags and go for lunch. when we got back we got our rooms and much to my pleasure me and my friends ended up getting the nicest room out of all, the teachers werent very pleased. the concierges were not the friendliest of people bu they were ok. The breakfasts they had there were not great but were a better quality than everywhere else we went in italy. many of these reviews were saying how bad the coffee machine was, but i can say when we were there the coffee machine was actually pretty good, so they must have replaced it. Overall i thought my stay in the holtel royal was enjoyable, it had a great location and was close to everything. although some of the other room on the 1st floor were small, they were a pretty good size.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A really good hotel with great character in good location Stayed at the Royal for 3 nights last week. Really good. Agree with comments in reviews 10/3/04, 10/9/04 and 30/9/04. We had a pleasant clean room on the first floor, overlooking the garden. We would certainly recommend this hotel.There's a good vegetarian restaurant just along the road (same side as hotel). A tip: It's best to order one course at a time.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: stay away My Fianc茅 and I recently visited Florence we stayed at the 鈥淗otel Royal鈥?for three nights, I have to write to you to tell you that it was the most stressful, disappointing and badly run hotel either of us have ever stayed in! Let me try to explain exactly what happened to make it so bad1. When we arrived at the hotel we were told that we hadn鈥檛 booked! The manager seemed very put out that he had to check his emails for our Internet booking.2. We were sent to our room, which was, when we got there full of people, plumbers and housemaids. The toilet was dissembled and the door was off its hinges!3. We booked a double room but we received a twin room and no apology or explanation!4. After about ten minutes in the room the manager came to our door and told us we had to go to a different room. He did not apologise just told us where the new room was!5. After about five minutes in this new room he came to the door again and told us we had to go back to the original room, again no apology.6. 20 minutes later he told us that there was something wrong with the plumbing and we were not allowed to use the shower! And if we really had to we should be really quick! And not make a mess (they had also taken our shower curtains)7. The following day we went out for lunch and when we got back we met the manager who greeted us with 鈥測e two are in big trouble鈥?he told us that somebody had stuffed nappies down the toilet and we couldn鈥檛 use our bathroom! So he was moving us to another new room, again he didn鈥檛 think of saying sorry!8. When we got to the new room we discovered it was a small single room, with one pillow and one towel. So we rang down to reception asking for extras, only to be told he will give us them the next time we go down! Madness. 9. When it came to checking out we asked for a reduction due to all the problems, he explained to us that Florenceby prices were old and out of date (鈧?30), and we actually got a very good deal 鈧?0 cheaper than it should be. Even though on the desk there was a list of prices. He also said we would have to pay the price of a double room for the single room!As you can see from this letter we are very very disappointed with this hotel, it does not deserve a one star let alone 3 stars!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: great location Fantastic location but have to agree with the Fawlty Towers breakfast! Get a new coffee machine!! Rooms are fAB really clean and comfy. Receptionists helpful and pleasant. Reasonable value for money
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: lovely building, poor food Four of us stayed at the hotel for 3 nights, we all agreed the building was lovely, formerly owned by an Italian Count apparently but was very dissapointed with the breakfast, compared to some of the continental buffet breakfasts we've had at other hotels in Italy this one was particularly poor, very limited choice, coffee machine appauling. The bar was also a dissapointment, it was tucked away in the corner of a beautiful lounge, we would have been quite happy to have sat and had a few drinks after a busy day walking the city but unfortunately they had never heard of Bacardi and had just a thimbleful of Gin left!! we did have couple of drinks there (beer and wine) very expensive. Careful of one of the gentlement on reception who has developed a clever line in I collect 拢2 coins if you have any to spare, then tells you the drink you've just ordered is free, only to slip it onto our friends bill at the end of our stay, very clever!! Having said that the rooms we had on the first floor were very clean and fairly spacious, should imagine the rooms on the 2nd floor were a lot smaller, linen and towels were changed every day and generally the staff were friendly with exception of the breakfast staff, very miserable.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Family hotel makes you feel at home Hi,We (my wife, my 7 years old daughter and my parents) stayed in Hotel Royal 6 days from 19 - 25 February 2005.The hotel rooms are simple, but spatious and clean. The room has a safe - which we did not use btw -, minibar, tv and a bathtub with a shower in it. It is possible to take a shower standing in the bathtub. The bed (matras) was comfortable. We slept very well and same for my parents. It was unusuably cold in florence (snow!), but the heating in the hotel and rooms worked fine.The hotel is located in the less touristic northern part of the center. It is in walking distance from the center. Even my parents (72+73 years old) could walk to San Marco, San Lorenzo, the Duomo and the ponte Vecchio which is one straight line following the Via San Gallo straight into the center), athough not as fast as we did. I think we walked in 8-10 minutes to San Lorenzo and Duomo. The advantage of the hotel location is that the prices are lower than in the heart of the touristic center. When comparing hotel prices and their location you could consider taking a daily taxi to the center (10 euro to the ponte Vecchio) and still save money compared to a more expensive hotel in the heart of the center. Also the restaurants are less expensive here. We especially liked the Trattoria da Tito on the Via San Gallo 112 (a short walk in Northen direction). The owners are very very hospitable, the food is excellent and very affordable (I saw a picture of Pavarotti dining here and a famous Italian actor whose name I forgot). You are really between the Italians here! We had 3 times diner and without asking were offered a free digestive. On our last night we received a free bottle of wine. I wish I was back here! The hotel Royal staff is very friendly. When we arrived in the hotel we immediately received a detailed map of Florence with explanation where to find the most important sites. The hotel reserved tickets for us for both Academia and Uffizi so that we did not have to wait in the long queue and could get into both museums almost directly.To our regret my mother had a flu and was ill for 3 days. The staff was very concerned about her well being, cleaned the room at her convenience and also offered to call a doctor at night. We were also offered a thermometer without asking.Breakfast was relatively simple but ok. The only point for improvement for me was that the breakfast servant could be a little bit more hospitable, but the work was well done.Particular nice for us in this family hotel was that the owners had lived in Holland for some years and spoke Dutch very well. This was especially nice for my parents who do not speak foreign languages that well. I hope this helps. Next time I will take this hotel again. Also by car is convenient as there is lot of space for car parking, which is unusual in the city center.I definitely enjoyed my stay here and hope/wish you will do as well.Kind regards,Fam. H. van der Wurff - The Netherlands
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hotel Royal a quiet oasis in Florence We just got back from staying three days at the Hotel Royal in Florence. It is an excellent hotel, with a nice room. It is extremely quiet, on a small street, with a huge lovely garden out back. The service was excellent and the breakfast adequate. It is convenient for walking to almost anywhere in Florence.It is also right across the street from one of our favorite restaurants in Tuscany, Vinolio, which is a wine bar with elegant, delicious, reasonably priced food and wine. This is not a touristy area, but it is certainly convenient. Highly recommended.
Reviews.Author: Chuckr

Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel, Great Location This is a lovely hotel, within walking distance of the Florence market and the train station. The hotel offers a nice place to stay with a quiet garden to escape the bussle of Florence should you choose. It is a lovely side of Florence which is not touristy in nature. Whilst the breakfasts had a limited buffet, I would highly recommend this hotel as a neat place to stay that makes your Florence visit just perfect.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Hotel with Florentine Flavor and Great Location I recently vacationed in Florence for the first time and could not have been happier with my hotel choice. Hotel Royal was a relaxed haven after a busy day of siteseeing. Family owned and run, the staff made me feel as part of their family. They were friendly, helpful and gracious in every way. My room was immaculately kept and extremely comfortable. Ample parking is provided at the hotel for those who chose to have a car at their disposal. It is centrally located and within walking distance of most anything you would want to see. I can not say enough about Hotel Royal but know that for me it will be my choice on my next visit to Florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
